SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Ski Lodges relative to Glamping Sites?
SRP.A: Ski Lodges is {above} Glamping Sites in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total average room price?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Ski Lodges}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total average room price?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Glamping Sites}.

EVJ.Q: What is the highest Average Room Price level recorded for Glamping Sites?

SC.Q: What is the average total Average Room Price?
SC.A: The average total average room price is {458.44} $.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Average Room Price fall between 421.15 and 465.48 $? Please list the years and corresponding total values.

NC.Q: Between 2001 and 2012, did the total Average Room Price experience a larger or smaller change than between 2008 and 2012?
NC.A: The change in total average room price between 2001 and 2012 was {larger} than between 2008 and 2012.

NC.Q: Between 1998 and 1999, did the total Average Room Price experience a larger or smaller change than between 1996 and 2011?
NC.A: The change in total average room price between 1998 and 1999 was {smaller} than between 1996 and 2011.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2006, did the total Average Room Price experience a larger or smaller change than between 1997 and 2013?
NC.A: The change in total average room price between 1997 and 2006 was {smaller} than between 1997 and 2013.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Room Price in 1997 higher or lower than in 2013?
NC.A: The total average room price in 1997 was {lower} than in 2013.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Ski Lodges} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Glamping Sites, Ski Lodges}.
